The graphics card (or GPU, for Graphics Processing Unit) is responsible for displaying the images on your monitor. Everything that you see on your monitor is generated by your graphics card. Many CPU's come with their own GPU's, which are far less powerful than their dedicated counterparts, yet still offer basic graphics support. While a GPU is not necessary in our computer builder, we highly recommend purchasing one to enhance any video games or HD videos you may be using. The more powerful video cards will allow for extreme realism in most games, and will provide the highest FPS (frames per second) possible.
If you plan on playing video games or HD videos, we suggest selecting a video card.
